channel.title: Buzzing on Quora
channel.description: 用中文浏览Quora上的热门回答

item.title: Dealing with co-parenting issues? Doctor Marsha Kline Pruett, Professor, Psychologist, Researcher, and Advisor to @OurFamilyWizard, shares 5 techniques for handling contentious situations. https://t.co/aOHElGlYJH https://t.co/BKQBHdOQ2z
What are some big shifts we’ll see with the Gig economy in 2022? @JordanPeace, CEO of Fringe, predicts the trends. https://t.co/AUf1vRf4an https://t.co/WEbwRnUjYv

So you're reading an answer on Quora and you don't know if it's any good. How do you tell? Upvotes are available, but they say more about popularity than the degree to which acting on the answer will achieve your goals. Comments have the same problem as the answer. THREAD!

What are some other countries where home cooking is considered best or where restaurant/street food is best, and what are some other characteristics of that culture that might correlate? Communal vs individualistic, maybe? https://t.co/UL66C3PU9t

Do you enjoy solving math and computer science puzzles? Would you like to try your hand at some user-tested puzzles derived from real-world challenges? Then you'll probably like the Quora Programming Challenge. https://t.co/yZxotfs7pJ p.s. There are cash prizes.
What does a Soviet-style "khrushchevka" apartment building look like on the inside? Russian Quora contributor Misha Firer explains in his typical hilarious idiom: https://t.co/1QqZyJpkGe

At Quora, we offer lots of support for writers, but haven't offered much for readers. Writing well is hard, but making sense of all the information out there is hard too. Would sensemaking support be valuable to readers?
Happy New Year everyone? What mountains, real or metaphorical, do you plan to climb this year? Fergus White has some first-hand tips for Everest: https://t.co/1VoOUaQ4ii

Interested in how Paxlovid works? Read this answer from Drug Development expert Christopher VanLang: https://t.co/QWnc1BVKg2 Coronaviruses have to assemble themselves in an infected cell to reproduce. Paxlovid blocks a tool used in assembly from working right.
